Acquisition

Author

Arpita Anand Prayag

1 Acquisition Challenges

1.1 1) Get some data via an API. There are millions of providers, that offer API access for free and have good documentation about how to query their service.

1.2 Running Code

Load libraries

library(RSQLite)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(httr)
library(glue)
library(jsonlite)
library(keyring)
library(rstudioapi)
library(rvest)

Send the GET request to the API

response <- GET("https://www.themealdb.com/api/json/v1/1/filter.php?c=Seafood")

Check the status code

if (response$status_code == 200) {
  # The request was successful
  # Get the response data

  meals_db <- response %>%
    .$content %>%
    rawToChar() %>%
    fromJSON()
  
  meals_db
} else {
  # The request failed
  print(response$status_code)
}

1.3 2) Scrape one of the competitor websites of canyon

Set the URL of the website to scrape

url <- "https://www.rosebikes.de/"

Scrape the website

html <- read_html(url)

# Find the elements that contain the model names
model_names <- html %>%
  html_nodes(".products-slider-tile__product-name") %>%
  html_text()

# Find the elements that contain the prices
prices <- html %>%
  html_nodes(".product-tile-price__current-value") %>%
  html_text()

# Extract the number using regular expressions
price <- gsub("[^0-9.,]", "", prices)  # Remove all non-digit, non-decimal, and non-comma characters

Create a data frame of the model names and prices

database <- data.frame(
  Model = model_names,
  Price = price
)

database
